property.name: _windowProperties
property.value: {bounds={-8, -8, 1382, 744}, maximized=true}

property.name: text
property.value: This is a simple traffic model, consisting of a few T-intersections,cross-intersections and streets. The Input ist controlled through a poisson clock, connected with a CSV-Reader, where our cars are put into the model. The key-part of the model is the analysis of the overloaded streets and intersections, if heavy traffic occurs (seen on the analysis) models can easily be configured. Parameter "StreetPlotterFlag": if 1 it shows the analysis on the plotters, if 0 only empty plotters appear.

property.name: text
property.value: Author: Sofia Bonini, Michael Breckner, Andrea Hofer

property.name: _type
property.value: {carId = int, roadMap = arrayType(int), indicator = int, intersectionCount = int}

property.value: {carId = int, roadMap = arrayType(int), indicator = int}

property.value: {carId = int, roadMap = arrayType(int), indicator = int}

property.name: _windowProperties
property.value: {bounds={158, 84, 928, 616}, maximized=false}

property.name: text
property.value: intersection-model that consists of "setIndicator" from each direction, that sets the indicator of the cars accordingly to their wanted direction. In the intersection the cars are sent to their prior setIndicator-direction. The two TimedPlotter are analysis tools for checking the workload

property.name: text
property.value: street-model that operates as an extension to the already implemented street(-queue) in the intersections. To simply add more controll to jam situations. Delays are needed to avoid "zero-delay-loops" between the JavaScripts.

property.name: _windowProperties
property.value: {bounds={219, 75, 928, 617}, maximized=false}

property.name: _windowProperties
property.value: {bounds={178, 39, 928, 617}, maximized=false}

property.name: text
property.value: Inner-street-model that adds cars to a waiting-queue, if the street itself is full. The counter constantly checks the size of the queue and fires a trigger, if the limit is reached. Otherwise we send the car to the output. Delays are needed to avoid "zero-delay-loops" between the JavaScripts.
